alert.note: Alert for Lake (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 10:40AM CDT until April 09 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...Wisconsin... Fox River Lower Near New Munster affecting Kenosha and Lake Counties. Fox River Near Berlin affecting Green Lake County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fox River Lower near New Munster. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.4 feet, There are about 2 inches of water over 77th Street in the Town of Wheatland area. Floodwaters are near some homes along Highway W in the Village of Salem Lakes area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 11.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CDT Friday was 11.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Sunday morning and continue falling to 9.5 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.5 feet on 06/05/2002. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && River forecasts are available for some but not all river gaging locations. The 7 day river forecast takes into account past precipitation, soil moisture conditions, and predicted precipitation for the basin. Precipitation is for the next 24 hours in the future from April through September and for 48 hours in the future from October through March. (Stages in ft.) Bank- Latest Forecast stages - Flood full observed ...for 1 pm... Location stage stage stage/time Sat Sun Mon Tue New Munster 11.0 10.0 11.40 10 am 4/07 11.2 10.9 10.6 10.3 - Highest 24 hour change - observed in river stage - stage in (ft.) up to Highest stage - the last latest observed forecast in - 7 days stage next 7 days New Munster 11.41 9 am 4/07 0.13 11.40 7 pm 4/07 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1045 PM CDT.
